evals.prompt: Create a do-nothing script from the asciinema cast file at ./_assets/asciinema/skills.cast
evals.expected_output: A do-nothing bash script written to ./tmp/skills_do_nothing.sh, with step functions derived from the cast recording, made executable, and validated with bash -n.
expectations: extract_commands.py is run with the .cast file path
The output script contains step_ functions
The output script contains a main() function
The output script contains wait_for_enter
bash -n is run to validate the script
chmod +x is applied to the output script

evals.prompt: I have a text file at /tmp/deploy_steps.txt listing the commands I run for a deployment. Create a do-nothing script from it.
evals.expected_output: A do-nothing bash script written to ./tmp/deploy_steps_do_nothing.sh, with one step function per logical group of commands from the text file.
expectations: extract_commands.py is run against the text file
The --format=text flag is used OR the file is auto-detected as text format
The output script contains step_ functions
The output script contains a main() function
bash -n is run to validate the script

evals.prompt: Use my recent shell history to generate a do-nothing script. Capture the last 20 commands.
evals.expected_output: history 20 is run and saved to a temp file; extract_commands.py processes it with history format; a do-nothing bash script is generated from the result.
expectations: history 20 is executed (or history N > /tmp/history.txt equivalent)
extract_commands.py is run with --format=history or the file is auto-detected as history format
The output script contains step_ functions
bash -n is run to validate the script

evals.prompt: I don't have a cast file or a text file. Help me create a do-nothing script for deploying a web application.
evals.expected_output: The agent interviews the user step-by-step, collecting the procedure via prompts, then generates a do-nothing bash script from the gathered steps.
expectations: The agent asks the user for the first step of the procedure
The agent continues asking for subsequent steps until the user indicates there are no more
The collected steps are written to a temporary text file or used directly
A do-nothing bash script is generated from the collected steps
bash -n is run to validate the script

evals.prompt: Create a do-nothing script from my text file at /tmp/steps.txt but treat it as history format.
evals.expected_output: extract_commands.py is run with --format=history to override auto-detection; a do-nothing script is generated from the parsed commands.
expectations: extract_commands.py is run with --format=history flag explicitly set
The output script contains step_ functions
bash -n is run to validate the script
